content: Write a sonnet using only words that begin with the letter "s".

Silent shadows softly sweep the stillness,
Serene skies shimmer with stars' soft sheen.
Solitary souls seek solace深深,
Soothing sighs sent skyward, sweet and clean.

Subtle scents of sage and sweet spring blossoms,
Stir senses, sparking spirits to soar.
Secluded spots where secrets softly toss,
Summoning specters of yore, evermore.

So, in this sacred space, I scribe my sorrow,
Seeking solace in sonnets, simple yet sage.
Perhaps, someday, someone shall share my sorrow,
Finding in these strains a semblance of sage.

Thus, I stand, surrounded by silence and shadows,
Spinning stories in syllables, soft and bold.
